lines.text: One person always loves more. That's what makes it so difficult. And the one who loves more is vulnerable.

Tolerance doesn't mean that everyone is the same. That'd be stupid. What I've learned here is how valuable differences are. Differences are good. And intelligent people will never hold it against you.
[Discussing that Walter wants to go back to Germany]
It's not that I don't like the English, it's more... That they don't like me.
Well, they don't like me either! I'm Scottish.
I can't buy anything. I'm as poor as a monkey.

[handing her a banana]
For the monkey.
I'm proud to be an idealist because it shows that I believe in mankind. That may sound naive but every other belief will lead to destruction.
Everything I love is on this bed.

[petting a stray dog]
We'll call him Rummler, like the Nazi chairman in Leobschutz. Everyday we can say Rummler, you bastard, and nobody will arrest us!
Are Mzungas like you still allowed to climb trees?
Yes. But only when they don't dirty their school uniform.
Do you think people should stay together for their whole life?
I guess not. It's probably just some nonsense which our ancestors persuaded us to adopt.
This country saved our lives, but it isn't our country!
